questions.text: Which of the following is a schedule X drug?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketamine Ketamine is used to provide general anesthesia. It works by causing reversible loss of consciousness. This allows surgical procedures to be carried out without pain and distress.

Highyeild:

Ketamine is a Schedule X drug. According to The Drugs and Cosmetics rules-1945, Schedule X drugs are those that nave high abuse liability and are too sold with a valid prescription only. The following are the Schedule X drugs mentioned in the Drugs and Cosmetics Rules 1945: Amobarbital, Amphetamine, Barbital, Cyclobarbital, Dexamphetamine, Ethchlorvynol, Glutethimide, Meprobamate, Methamphetamine, Methylphenidate, Methyl phenobarbital, Phencyclidine(Ketamine) , Phenmetrazine, Secobarbital.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Thalidomide is an oral medication used to treat a number of cancers (e.g. multiple myeloma), graft-versus-host disease, and many skin disorders (e.g. complications of leprosy such as skin lesions). Option B. Colistin is an antibiotic medication used as a last-resort treatment for multidrug-resistant Gram-negative infections including pneumonia. These may involve bacteria such as Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Klebsiella pneumoniae, or Acinetobacter.

Table:

#MANTRA Import of the Schedule-X drugs (Narcotic & Psychotropic drugs) Conditions to be fulfilled: Licensee must have adequate storage facility. Applicant must be reputable in the occupation, trade or business. The license granted even before should not be suspended or cancelled. The licensee has not been convicted any offence under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act or Narcotic and Psychotropic Substances Act.

questions.text: A nurse got accidental prick from the HIV infected needle. Which of the following statements is false regarding the management of this nurse?

options.label: A
options.text: Zidovudine used as monotherapy in post-exposure prophylaxis

options.label: B
options.text: Washing hands with soap and water is advised

options.label: C
options.text: Baseline viral markers of health care personnel should be done at the time of prick

options.label: D
options.text: Follow up viral markers of health care personnel should be measured at 6 weeks

questions.correct_answer: A. Zidovudine used as monotherapy in post-exposure prophylaxis
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Zidovudine used as monotherapy in post-exposure prophylaxis

Highyeild:

Zidovudine is no longer recommended in the preferred PEP regimen. The first dose of PEP should be given as soon as possible after exposure, ideally within 2 hours. The recommended duration of PEP is 28 days. Preferred regimen is: Tenofovir + lamivudine + Lopinavir/ Ritonavir for 28 days if not available Tenofovir + lamivudine + efavirenz for 28 days

Table:

#MANTRA Antiretroviral Medications NRTI Abacavir, ABC (Ziagen") Didanosine, ddi (Videx®, Videx EC®) Emtricitabine, FTC (Emtriva") Lamivudine, 3TC (Epivir") Stavudine, d4T (Zeri) Tenofovir alafenamide, TAF Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate, TDF (Viread*) Zidovudine, AZT/ZDV (Retrovir) Pls Atazanavir, ATV (Reyataz®) Darunavir, DRV (Prezista®) Fosamprenavir, FPV (Lexiva®) Indinavir, IDV (Crixivan") Nelfinavir, NFV (Viracept*) Ritonavir, RTV/r" (Norvir®) Saquinavir, SQV (Invirase") Tipranavir, TPV (Aptivus) Fusion Inhibitor Enfuvirtide, ENF/T-20 (Fuzeon®) Entry Inhibitor Maraviroc, MVC (Selzentry®) Ibalizumab (Trogarzo) PK Enhancer Cobicistat, COBI/C (Tybost®) Ritonavir, RTV/r (Norvir) NNRTI Delavirdine, DLV (Rescriptor®) Efavirenz, EFV (Sustiva®) Etravirine, ETR (Intelence) Nevirapine, NVP (Viramune®, Viramune XR®) Rilpivirine, RPV (Edurant®) Doravirine, DOR (Pifeltro") INSTIS Bictegravir, BIC (Bictarvy®) Dolutegravir, DTG (Tivicay®) Elvitegravir, EVG (Vitekta") Raltegravir, RAL (Isentress™)

questions.text: Tramadol mechanism of action other than µ receptor agonism is:
questions.correct_answer: C. Serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibition
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibition Tramadol Is a synthetic codeine analogue that is mu – opiod receptor agonist. Tramadol is used to treat moderate to severe pain in adults It also acts by inhibiting the uptake of serotonin & norepinephrine Along with SSRI increases risk of serotonin syndrome High dose causes seizures

questions.text: A 10 year-old child presents with easily pluckable hair and black dots on the scalp as given in the Image. The drug of choice for the condition is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Griseofulvin The condition shown is Tinea capitis Griseofulvin Fungi static drug obtained from Penicillium griseofulvum Acts by causing disruption of the mitotic spindle and inhibition of fungal mitosis Used orally and topically it is not effective DOC for tinea capitis in children

questions.text: Which of the following is not used in heart failure?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Trimetazidine Trimetazidine is not used in heart failure. Trimetazidine is a newer antianginal drug that is a pFOX inhibitor. This decreases the oxygen requirement of the heart. Trimetazidine is an anti-ischemic (anti-anginal) metabolic agent, which improves myocardial glucose utilization through inhibition of fatty acid metabolism, also known as fatty acid oxidation inhibitor.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Metoprolol is a beta blocker used in chronic CHF Sacubitril is a ARNi used in chronic CHF Nesiritide is a BNP analogue used in acute CHF

questions.text: All of the following can cause miosis except:-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Belladonna Belladonna: anticholinergic alkaloid which contains atropine Atropine competitively inhibit Ach actions at muscarinic receptors by blocking M3 receptors on sphincter papillae causes passive mydriasis Organophosphates and Pilocarpine are cholinergic drugs, acts by stimulating M3 receptors on sphincter papillae causes active miosis Morphine causes miosis.

Solution:

Chronic gout Pegloticase is used for chronic gout. Pegloticase is a recombinant mammalian uricase which is used in the treatment of refractory chronic gout. This enzyme converts uric acid to allantoin which is highly soluble and can be eliminated from kidney

questions.text: Which of the following statements about tedizolid is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Peripheral neuropathy is a common adverse effect

options.label: B
options.text: It is active against gram-positive organisms

options.label: D
options.text: Major mode of elimination is renal excretion

questions.correct_answer: B. It is active against gram-positive organisms
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It is active against gram-positive organisms Tedizolid is active against gram-positive organisms. Tedizolid belongs to the class oxazolidinones Active against gram-positive organisms. It has poor activity against most gram-negative bacteria and anaerobes. It inhibits protein synthesis by binding to the P site of the 50 S ribosomal subunit. Tedizolid is well absorbed after oral administration (bioavailability > 80%). Tedizolid displays greater protein binding (70%–90%) Minimal elimination of unchanged drug in the urine The drug undergoes sulfation in the liver and is excreted primarily in the feces

questions.text: Inhibition of which presynaptic ion channels will decrease release of acetylcholine from the nerve terminal:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Voltage gated calcium channel Presynaptic Voltage gated calcium ion channels will increase release of acetylcholine from the nerve terminal Physiologic release of transmitter from the vesicles is dependent on extracellular calcium and occurs when an action potential reaches the terminal and triggers sufficient influx of calcium ions via N-type calcium channels. Calcium interacts with the VAMP synaptotagmin on the vesicle membrane and triggers fusion of the vesicle membrane with the terminal membrane and opening of a pore into the synapse The opening of the pore and inrush of cations results in release of the acetylcholine from the proteoglycan and exocytotic expulsion into the synaptic cleft. so Inhibition of presynaptic Voltage gated calcium channel channels will decrease release of acetylcholine from the nerve terminal

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding foscarnet are True and False:

options.label: A
options.text: (A = TRUE / B = TRUE / C = FALSE / D = TRUE / E = TRUE)

options.label: B
options.text: (A = FALSE / B = TRUE / C = FALSE / D = TRUE / E = TRUE)

options.label: C
options.text: (A = FALSE / B = TRUE / C = TRUE / D = TRUE / E = FLASE)

questions.correct_answer: A. (A = TRUE / B = TRUE / C = FALSE / D = TRUE / E = TRUE)
questions.explanation:
Solution:

(A = TRUE / B = TRUE / C = FALSE / D = TRUE / E = TRUE) Foscarnet is an antiviral medicati on which is primarily used to treat viral infections involving the Herpesviridae family. It is classified as a pyrophosphate analog DNA polymerase inhibitor . It can cause genital ulceration. Mechanism of action: Foscarnet is a structural mimic of the anion pyrophosphate that selectively inhibits the pyrophosphate binding site on viral DNA polymerases at concentrations that do not affect human DNA polymerases. It is used to treat herpes viruses, including drug-resistant cytomegalovirus (CMV) and herpes simplex viruses types 1 and 2 (HSV-1 and HSV-2). It is particularly used to treat CMV retinitis. it is nephrotoxic, so needs dose reduction in renal failure causes hypocalcaemia and needs regular electrolyte monitoring

questions.text: GPCR not acting through secondary messenger via potassium channels is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Angiotensin 1 receptor Angiotensin 1 receptor does not act through secondary messenger via potassium channel. G protein-coupled receptors (GPCRs), also known as seven-(pass)-transmembrane domain receptors. There are two principal signal transduction pathways involving the G protein-coupled receptors: G s and Gi acts through cAMP signal pathway Gi inhibits Adenyl cyclase and decreases c AMP and OPENS K channel Muscarinic M2 receptor, Dopamine D2 receptor and Serotonin 5 HT1 receptor acts through Gi receptors Gs activates adenyl cyclase and increases c – AMP. Gq acts through IP3/ DAG signal pathway .

questions.text: A patient was given ampicillin 2g intravenously. After that, the person developed rash on skin, hypotension and difficulty in breathing. This patient should be managed by:

options.label: A
options.text: 0.5 ml of 1:1000 adrenaline by intramuscular route

options.label: B
options.text: 0.5 ml of 1:10000 adrenaline by intravenous route

options.label: C
options.text: 0.5 ml of 1:10000 adrenaline by intramuscular route

options.label: D
options.text: 0.5 ml of 1:1000 adrenaline by intravenous route

questions.correct_answer: A. 0.5 ml of 1:1000 adrenaline by intramuscular route
questions.explanation:
Solution:

0.5 ml of 1:1000 adrenaline by intramuscular route Epinephrine (1:1000 solution) 0.5 ml I.M. is treatment of choice for anaphylactic shock.

Solution:

5HT4 agonist Prucalopride is a specific 5HT4 receptor agonist which increases bowel movements. This medication is used to treat chronic constipation. It is used when other medications used to treat constipation (such as laxatives) have not provided relief.

questions.text: Which of the following is True or False regarding drugs used for viral infection? Treatment with ribavirin is considered better than sofosbuvir for hepatitis C Infection Ombitasvir is inhibitor of protein synthesis Imiquimod is used for Condyloma acuminata Oseltamivir is used for swine flu Select the correct answer from the given below code:-

options.label: A
options.text: (A = FALSE / B = FALSE / C = TRUE / D = TRUE)

options.label: B
options.text: (A = TRUE / B = FALSE / C = TRUE / D = TRUE)

options.label: C
options.text: (A = FALSE / B = TRUE / C = TRUE / D = FALSE)

options.label: D
options.text: (A = FALSE / B = TRUE / C = FALSE / D = TRUE)

questions.correct_answer: A. (A = FALSE / B = FALSE / C = TRUE / D = TRUE)
questions.explanation:
Solution:

(A = FALSE / B = FALSE / C = TRUE / D = TRUE) For Hepatitis c infection, the newer direct acting antivirals for hepatitis C virus are better than older drugs like ribavirin. Sofosbuvir is a RNA polymerase NS5B Inhibitor and used with Daclatasvir and Sofosbuvir combination with or without ribavirin is used for the treatment of chronic HCV genotype 1 or 3 infection for 12 weeks Ledipasvir and Sofosbuvir combination with or without ribavirin is used for the treatment of chronic HCV genotype 1,4,5,6 infection for 12 weeks Ombitasvir is a NS5A Inhibitor Protease inhibitors (NS3/4 Inhibitors) are Telaprevir, Boceprevir Imiquimod is used for Condyloma acuminata Oseltamivir is used for swine flu

questions.text: A patient presented to emergency with overdose of some drug. There were increased salivation and increased bronchial secretions. On examination, blood pressure was 88/60 mmHg. RBC esterase level is 50. What should be the treatment of this person?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Atropine Low esterase levels are suggestive of overdose of some drug which acts by inhibiting acetyl choline esterase like organophosphate poisoning. Inhibition of choline esterase results in increased amount of Ach at synapse, so Poisoning or overdose results in cholinergic symptoms like salivation, lacrimation, Urination, emesis, increased bronchial secretions, reduction in blood pressure. So treatment of choice is Atropine.

questions.text: A patient was schedule for surgery. Before giving anesthesia, he was administered glycopyrrolate. What is rationale of giving glycopyrrolate before anesthesia?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

To decrease secretions Preanesthetic medication refers to the use of drugs before anaesthesia to make it safe and less unpleasant. Glycopyrrolate Injection is indicated for use as a preoperative antimuscarinic to reduce salivary, tracheobronchial, and pharyngeal secretions. To reduce the volume and free acidity of gastric secretions; and to block cardiac vagal inhibitory reflexes during induction of anesthesia and intubation.

questions.text: Which of the following is clinical use of tafenoquine?

options.label: D
options.text: Treatment of endemic malaria in children <2 years

questions.correct_answer: A. Radical cure of Plasmodium vivax
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Radical cure of Plasmodium vivax Tafenoquine is used in the radical cure of vivax. Tafenoquine is a derivative of primaquine and has very high activity against the latent tissue forms (hypnozoite). It is primarily used for the chemoprophylaxis and radical cure of P. vivax and P. ovale infections. Half-life is around 14 days Tafenoquine is only the second drug of its kind to receive FDA approval.
